title: McMahon Score for Rhabdomyolysis
description: Predicts mortality or acute kidney injury (AKI) requiring renal replacement therapy in hospitalized rhabdomyolysis patients. The score helps identify low-risk patients unlikely to have severe adverse outcomes.

parameters.name: initial_cpk_high
parameters.description: Initial creatine phosphokinase (CPK) greater than 40,000 U/L

result.name: mcmahon_score
result.description: McMahon Score for predicting mortality or AKI requiring RRT in rhabdomyolysis

ranges.description: Low risk for death or AKI requiring RRT
ranges.interpretation: 3% risk of death or acute kidney injury requiring renal replacement therapy. Consider standard supportive care with fluid resuscitation and monitoring.

ranges.description: Not low risk for adverse outcomes
ranges.interpretation: Increased risk of death or acute kidney injury requiring renal replacement therapy. Consider aggressive renal protective therapy including high-volume fluid resuscitation, close monitoring of renal function, and early nephrology consultation.

references: McMahon GM, Zeng X, Waikar SS. A risk prediction score for kidney failure or mortality in rhabdomyolysis. JAMA Intern Med. 2013 Oct 28;173(19):1821-8. doi: 10.1001/jamainternmed.2013.9774.

Safari S, Yousefifard M, Hashemi B, Baratloo A, Forouzanfar MM, Rahmati F, et al. The value of serum creatine kinase in predicting the risk of rhabdomyolysis-induced acute kidney injury: a systematic review and meta-analysis. Clin Exp Nephrol. 2016 Apr;20(2):153-61. doi: 10.1007/s10157-015-1204-1.

Premru V, Kovač J, Buturović-Ponikvar J, Ponikvar R. Some kinetic considerations in the treatment of acute kidney injury caused by rhabdomyolysis. Ther Apher Dial. 2017 Oct;21(5):451-456. doi: 10.1111/1744-9987.12547.
formula: Score = (Age points) + (Sex points) + (Initial Creatinine points) + (Initial Calcium <7.5 mg/dL points) + (Initial CPK >40,000 U/L points) + (Rhabdo Cause points) + (Initial Phosphate points) + (Initial Bicarbonate <19 mEq/L points)
notes: Known causes include: seizures, syncope, exercise, statins, and myositis (0 points). Other causes score 3 points.
Developed for patients with CPK >5,000 U/L within 3 days of admission.
A score ≥6 is 68% specific and 86% sensitive for predicting need for RRT.
The score helps identify patients who may benefit from aggressive fluid resuscitation early in their course.
Initial laboratory values should be obtained on admission or as close to admission as possible.
